page.title: 18Biography
page.content: Mr.Kinloch whose father was headmaster has lived in Cardross all his life. He was 7 when the Second World War broke out. He remembers the fire in the old church and being terrified by the bombing. He never saw a banana until he was 14. His mother used to give her sons the pulp of an orange and make marmalade with the skin. She used to make her own lemonade. When the war ended people who had bicycles decorated them with crepe paper and paraded through the streets rejoicing. He played rounders and king ball as a boy and joined the Golf Club when he was 8. On Sunday nights the family played cards or had a musical evening. He can remember when the electric trains replaced stream trains.
